messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, nigeltao@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

Thanks for this.

As far as I can tell, you have not previously contributed to leveldb-go, or to the core Go project. Please complete a Contributor License Agreement: http://golang.org/doc/contribute.html#copyright

http://codereview.appspot.com/5475057/diff/1002/leveldb/table/table_test.go
File leveldb/table/table_test.go (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5475057/diff/1002/leveldb/table/table_test.go#newcode33
leveldb/table/table_test.go:33: return memFileStat(*f), nil
Instead of a separate type, you could have memFile just implement os.FileInfo directly.

*** Submitted as 49af52dd826e ***

leveldb: go1rename and time+fileinfo gofix.

R=golang-dev, nigeltao
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5475057

Committer: Nigel Tao <nigeltao@golang.org>

On 2011/12/10 02:58:46, nigeltao wrote:
> Please complete a Contributor License Agreement:
Done

> http://codereview.appspot.com/5475057/diff/1002/leveldb/table/table_test.go#newcode33
> leveldb/table/table_test.go:33: return memFileStat(*f), nil
> Instead of a separate type, you could have memFile just implement os.FileInfo
> directly.
Done. I just thought the code would be cleaner with a separate type, but it's just a TC, so its probably fine.

Many thanks for reviewing my first little change! :)

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/leveldb-go/

subject: code review 5475057: leveldb: go1rename and time+fileinfo gofix.
